messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] This List
messages.msgSnippet: Hi ~ I don t have time to read everything, but sigh........I finally found a homeschool home, this list is REAL.....and so are the people.......I feel like I
messages.messageBody:
Hi ~

I don't have time to read everything, but sigh........I finally found a
homeschool home, this list is REAL.....and so are the people.......I feel like I
could say what I'm REALLY thinking.....now if I can find time. It also is
confirming my conviction that Unschool really is magical. Being patient, and not
pushing, and letting them find their way by their heart.....amazing. Not that I
do that now.....I'm still trying to deschool myself...but it is my final
goal. Just to relax, and know everything is going to be okay. To realize, these
incredible boys of mine, have incredible dreams in their heads, and to allow
them to follow that, is the greatest gift of all. Anyway, continue talking about
the doables, and the styles and ideas of homeschool....and overweight
children <I'm trying to relax on that one, too> and our dreams....... it's good to be
in a real world.

Thanks~
Michelle
p.s. Do any of you belong to a local homeschool support group? How
supportive are they with unschool?


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: This List
messages.msgSnippet: I know I have added fuel to the fire at times on this list. Sometimes, who I show up as here is not my best. Sometimes it is. I guess I can only be who I am at
messages.messageBody:
I know I have added fuel to the fire at times on this list. Sometimes, who I
show up as here is not my best. Sometimes it is. I guess I can only be who I
am at any given moment. If I have hurt anyone's feelings, I do apologize. I
don't think it has been my intention to do so, but possibly I speak without
really thinking about the effect of my words sometimes. I do not apologize
for stating my beliefs about various things . . . that would be very contrary
to who I am as an unschooler and just as a human be-ing.

I do not always agree with Sandra, and have no probelm saying so, but I like
most others, really respect her and what she has to say about unschooling. I
don't like the quibbling either, and sometimes I get sucked right down into
it. I do believe that most of the time Sandra stays focused on ideas and
unschooling. . . probably 99 percent of the time. Anyway, I didn't mean this
to be a focus on her, but rather on my part in it all. I think I get caught
up in trying to get others to "see" how they are interacting in the whole
drama/situation. . . it really is not my job though. It is a mirror to me
though and it shows me something I need to work on, which is really all
anyone can do. . . stop focusing on others and focus on the work within.

lovemary

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] This List

messages.messageBody:
> I think you all deserve a hand for the tolerance, honesty, acceptance and
> maturity I have witnessed over the life of this list, without getting
overly
> serious with ourselves.

Aw heck, Nanci, we're only mature when we're not being childish! Seriously,
though, I think that has something to do with it: we unschoolers don't have
to be mature ALL the time!

:-) Diane

messages.subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] This List
messages.msgSnippet: You know, it never ceases to amaze me how well the diverse and LARGE population of this list gets along.  It is one of the best behaved and well integrated
messages.messageBody:
You know, it never ceases to amaze me how well the diverse and LARGE population of this list gets along. It is one of the best behaved and well integrated lists I have ever seen, from a wide range of types of lists. I think you all deserve a hand for the tolerance, honesty, acceptance and maturity I have witnessed over the life of this list, without getting overly serious with ourselves.

Nanci K.

messages.subject: Re: This List
messages.msgSnippet: You know, the first few days I was on this list, I didn t get ANYTHING.  When I posted to ask why, I was told that it was brand new and no-one was here yet!
messages.messageBody:
You know, the first few days I was on this list, I didn't get ANYTHING. When I posted to ask why, I was told that it was brand new and no-one was here yet! Tee hee...Imagine that, me an old timer at 27. :-) I have seen plenty of heated topics come and go, and the latest one shall too.

What a wonderful resource this list has been for me, and I love you all for your many and diverse contributions. How wonderful that we do NOT all agree on every topic, so that we may learn from and be enriched by each other's diversity. Drink deeply and be refreshed! But don't gorge yourself or you will get sick! :-)

Nanci K.
